hotspots.label: Stigma and Stamens
hotspots.fact: The yellow ball-shaped parts at the very top are called the stigma, and the thin structures below with orange tips are stamens. These are the flower's reproductive parts that help make seeds!

hotspots.label: Stamen Filaments
hotspots.fact: These thread-like orange and yellow structures are called stamens, and they produce pollen. Pollen is like flower dust that helps create new plants when it travels to other flowers.

hotspots.label: Pink Petals
hotspots.fact: These bright pink petals attract insects like bees and butterflies to the flower. The insects come for nectar to eat, and in return, they help spread pollen between flowers!

hotspots.label: Pistil and Style
hotspots.fact: The thick pale tube connecting the petals to the reproductive parts is called the style. It leads down to the ovary where seeds will develop after pollination happens.
